page.title: 14A FRUIT FARMER IN ARDLEIGH
page.content: {Hull Farm}is a local fruit farm that covers{125 acres.}The owner grows{apples}- cox's orange pippin and bramley:{pears}- conference and comice, and{plums.}He also grows and sells{conifers}and{small shrubs.}There are usually{5 employees,}but in {September}and{October}there are about {30}as it is the{picking season. {Cherry Tree Farm}also belongs to the same person. When the{by-pass}was built there were problems getting between the farms.A{bridge}was built over the road and Hull Farm lost 2 acres.At Hull Farm{crops}are{rotated every 25-30 years.{Pruning}takes place in winter,{spraying}in the spring and {harvesting}in the autumn.The trees are kept{low}to make{picking}easy.There are{special narrow tractors}to fit through the gaps between the rows of trees.
